thread.title: Shoreditch High Street evacuated over ‘possible WW2 bomb’
thread.title_full: Shoreditch High Street evacuated over ‘possible WW2 bomb’

author: eflynn
title: Shoreditch High Street evacuated over ‘possible WW2 bomb’
text:
A police investigation is underway in Shoreditch after a ‘possible ordnance’ was found 
Most of the bustling high street was cleared after a “possible ordnance” was reported. 
After a police investigation the road was reopened and traffic has now been allowed back through the area. 
Delays are still expected in the area as the congestion clears. RELATED STORIES LABOUR OF LOVE WW2 Lancaster bomber is being restored after it was bought by brothers whose sibling was killed in 1944 air raid BOMB SCARE Unexploded World War Two bomb causes chaos in central London as bridges and tubes locked down STONE ME Traffic mayhem to deal with 'WW2 bomb' which was actually a ROCK Tunnel vision Inside the UK’s largest purpose-built WW2 bomb shelter where thousands sought refuge from Nazi attacks BOMB SCARE Homes evacuated for 12 hours after the discovery of a 'live' WW2 GRENADE in sleepy cul-de-sac NAZI SURPRISE First pic of WW2 bomb that caused London traffic chaos forcing Westminster and Waterloo Bridges to close 
A Met Police spokesman said the road was evacuated after reports of “World War 2 ordnance”. 
The operation has since been stood down. 
Twitter users warned commuters to “stay clear” of the area. Traffic has been diverted from the area and both directions are closed on the busy High Street Heavy police presence as Shoreditch High Street area is evacuated 
TfL Traffic News tweeted earlier today: "Shoreditch High St is CLOSED both ways at Great Eastern St due to an police incident. Drivers are advised to seek an alternative route." 
Shoreditch is a trendy area in London full of office spaces, restaurants and coffee shops. 
Lancelot Paterson said: "Bomb scare in Shoreditch (But being Shoreditch, an upcycled antique bomb,obviously). Stay clear and stay safe." 
Hector Galvis said: "WWII shell found in Shoreditch. Road was closed now all back to normal. All activities resuming in hipster land."
